DataElement.preferredName: Patient Metastatic Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a patient meets the eligibility criteria with regards to metastatic disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Metastatic Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Metastatic Neoplasm Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have metastatic
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic disease defined as new or progressive lesions on cross sectional imaging, including at least: one evaluable site of disease or, appearance of one new bone lesion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic disease or locally recurrent, unresectable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have greater than or equal to 2 bone metastases by radiographic imaging and at least 1 lesion which has not been treated with prior radiation therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic disease by bone scan or other nodal or visceral lesions on CT or MRI?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed malignancy that is metastatic or unresectable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic breast cancer with two or more bone metastases identified by 99mTc bone scintigraphy and/or CT and at least one bone lesion that has not been treated with prior radiation therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinical stage IV breast cancer with known metastatic disease, HER2+ breast cancer patients with any ER/PR status as assessed by ASCO-CAP guidelines?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have another invasive malignancy within the past 5 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 001
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have widely metastatic disease (greater than 10 metastases)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic prostate cancer with neuroendocrine differentiation, as determined by at least one of the following:  Histologically confirmed small cell or neuroendocrine cancer from a primary prostate or metastatic biopsy.   Prostate adenocarcinoma with molecular features of neuroendocrine differentiated cancer (e.g., 2 of the following 3:  PTEN, TP53, or RB loss).  	Progression of visceral metastases in the absence of PSA progression.  Or Serum chromogranin A greater than 5x normal limit, or neuron-specific enolase greater than 2x normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any metastases (including brain)?
